Home

Life in Dehradun

Dehradun is the capital of Uttarakhand, a state in India. It is located in the Doon Valley on the foothills of the Himalayas in the Garhwal region. It is nestled between the river Ganges on the east and the river Yamuna on the west. The city is famous for its picturesque landscape and slightly milder climate and provides a gateway to the surrounding region. It is well connected and in proximity to Himalayan tourist destinations such as Mussoorie, and Auli and the Hindu holy cities of Haridwar and Rishikesh along with the Himalayan pilgrimage circuit of Chota Char Dham. It lies 147 miles north of India's capital New Delhi. It is one of the nine counter magnet areas to National Capital Region NCR as zone of influence for migration and alternative centre of growth.

Surya Narayan Sah is Dehradun born scientist whose family moved to Bihar. He did his Engineering in Mechanical and worked for Indian Railways before joining the Central Salt and Marine Chemicals Research Institute (formerly Central Salt Research Institute). The Institute was inaugurated by Jawahar Lal Nehru the First Prime Minister of India on 10 April 1954 at Bhavnagar, in Gujarat. Central Salt and Marine Chemicals Research Institute is a constituent laboratory of the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR), India.

CSMCRI carry out research on marine salt, and salt from inland lakes and sub-soil brine. It has achieved technological excellence with several granted patents in the core mandate of the institute and is one among the top performing national R&D laboratories in the country. Mr. Surya Narayan was part of various technologies developed by CSIR and maintenance of that which includes Development of Specialty Inorganic Materials for Diverse Applications, Development of hollow fibre membrane technology for water disinfection/purification and waste water reclamation, Mapping of the Marine Biodiversity along the Indian Coast, Preparations of nutrient-rich salt of plant origins, Electrodialysis domestic desalination system, Preparation of low sodium salt of botanic origin Nanocrystalline dye-sensitized solar cells (DSSC), Recovery of precious metal ions from natural sources.
